isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE SYMPTOMS DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Priming the Fuel System

svcsubproc.title: Priming without Vacuum Source

note.para: If during diagnosis of concern, all three of the following issues are noted: fuel system will not prime, engine is exhibiting white to black smoke, and fuel pressure is pulsating, see Combustion Leaks to Fuel, in this Section.

svcsubproc.para: In the event a run out of fuel condition occurs, observe the following instructions:

step1.para: Add fuel to tank. If equipped with dual tanks, add fuel to passenger side tank. Check fuel level in operator side tank to verify transfer pump is operating properly.
Remove fuel filter cap using a band wrench. Leave filter in housing.
Fill fuel filter housing with diesel fuel up to the filter cap threads.
Replace fuel filter cap and tighten.
Engage starter for 30 seconds and allow starter to cool for 2 minutes.

note.para: Return key to RUN position only between starts to decrease load on batteries. This will prevent glow plugs from recycling.

caution.para: To avoid damage to starter, if engine fails to start within 30 seconds, release ignition switch and wait 2-3 minutes to allow starter motor to cool. Repeat above procedure.

step1.para: Repeat step 5 until engine starts and runs on its own.

item.para: 3 to 5 cranking periods will be required to start vehicle. Additional cranking periods may be required if fuel filter is not primed.

para.emph: NOTE: Bus applications with rear tank will require additional cranking periods because of increased distance from fuel tanks.

note.para: If during diagnosis of concern, all three of the following issues are noted: fuel system will not prime, engine is exhibiting white to black smoke, and fuel pressure is pulsating, see Combustion Leaks to Fuel, in this Section.

step1.para: Add fuel to tank. If equipped with dual tanks, add fuel to passenger side tank. Check fuel level in operator side tank to verify transfer pump is operating properly.
Install fuel pressure test fitting in unfiltered fuel test port.
Attach vacuum source to fuel/oil pressure test coupling and connect to fuel pressure test fitting.
Draw fuel from tank using vacuum source until level in fuel filter housing reaches fitting.
Disconnect vacuum source and fuel/oil pressure test coupler from fuel pressure test fitting.
Engage starter for 30 seconds and allow starter to cool for 2 minutes.

note.para: Return key to RUN position only between starts to decrease load on batteries. This will prevent glow plugs from recycling.

caution.para: To avoid damage to starter, if engine fails to start within 30 seconds, release ignition switch and wait 2-3 minutes to allow starter motor to cool. Repeat above procedure.

step1.para: Repeat step 5 until engine starts and runs on its own.

item.para: 2 to 4 cranking periods will be required to start vehicle. Additional cranking periods may be required if fuel filter is not primed.

step1.para: After engine has been started and is running smoothly, stop engine and remove fuel pressure test fitting and reinstall plug in filter housing.
